alert.note: Alert for Orange; Scott; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 20 at 2:21AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Scott, northeastern Orange and northern Washington Counties through 245 AM EDT... At 220 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from near Seymour to 9 miles south of Brownstown to 7 miles northeast of Paoli. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsburg, Salem, Austin, Campbellsburg, Little York, Saltillo, Kossuth, Leipsic, Smedley, and Claysville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, seek shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
